item.description:
Grassland Restoration

Reversing Global Warming While Meeting Human Needs

 

:: :: ::

 

An informal discussion on Holistic Land Management and the work of Allan Savory

 

Note: Allan will NOT be present at this event.

 

:: :: ::

 

Tuesday, April 16, 2013 - 7:00pm

Cambridgeport Baptist Church

459 Putnam Avenue

(corner of Magazine Street and Putnam)

Cambridge, MA

:: :: ::

 

Allan Savory, an internationally known restoration ecologist, recently gave an electrifying talk to a packed lecture hall at Tufts. People were on their feet after hearing how grazing animals can restore grasslands while pulling carbon out of the atmosphere, replenishing scarce water resources, and increasing global food supply.  Now local climate activists Adam Sacks and Jim Laurie are bringing this work to the Northeast. Come hear about our best chance to address the climate emergency and what we can do to promote this effort. Join us!

Jim Laurie, a restoration ecologist, nature philosopher, and teacher.  Some of his best friends are dung beetles, methanotrophs (ask him), worms and fungi.

Adam Sacks, who has been a climate activist since the turn of the millennium. He's been studying Holistic Management since Jim introduced it to him in 2007, and sees it as the only thing that has a reasonable chance of turning our excess carbon into new life.

Information about the Savory Institute at http://www.savoryinstitute.com

Greenport Forum: GreenPort envisions and encourages a just and sustainable Cambridgeport neighborhood

Contact Name: Steve Wineman
steven.wineman@gmail.com
item.name: Grassland Restoration (sans Savory)
